snippet: The change, recently advocated by military officials and lawmakers, could be the most significant for the Selective Service System in decades.
abstract: Proposed legislation requiring women to register with United States Selective Service System stirs national debate; supporters cite opening of combat roles to women as grounds for requirement, while critics claim measure bows to political correctness; registration is still mandatory for men aged 18 to 25, despite draft not being used since 1973.

byline.contributor: Matt Flegenheimer contributed reporting from Manchester, N.H.

lead_paragraph: The change, recently advocated by military officials and lawmakers, could be the most significant for the Selective Service System in decades.

headline.main: Draft Registration for Women Would Stir a Sleepy Government Agency
headline.print_headline: Draft Registration for Women Would Stir a Sleepy Government Agency

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
